alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Dragoon, Mule, Huachuca and Santa Rita Mountains including Bisbee, Canelo Hills, Madera Canyon; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox; Galiuro and Pinaleno Mountains including Mount Graham; Upper Gila River and Aravaipa Valleys including Clifton, Safford; Upper San Pedro River Valley including Sierra Vista, Benson (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 3:35PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Graham and northeastern Cochise Counties through 415 PM MST... At 334 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles west of Roper Lake State Park to 12 miles east of Willcox to near Portal. Movement was southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Willcox, Bowie, Chiricahua National Monument, Pearce-Sunsites, Cochise, Sunizona, Fort Grant, Rucker Canyon, Mount Graham, Bonita, Frye Mesa Dam and Kansas Settlement. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 324 and 368. Route 181 between mile markers 39 and 64. Route 186 between mile markers 327 and 359. Route 191 between mile markers 34 and 103. Route 266 between mile markers 105 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
